title: Brazil: Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards Highlight Top Entrepreneurs Funded by Microfinance
summary: São Paulo - Citi's Microentrepreneurship Award celebrates its eighth edition this year. Funded by the Citi Foundation in 28 countries, the award honors entrepreneurs who employ microfinance resources to boost their businesses, either through startups or by improving products and services, and contribute to economic and social development within their communities. Microfinance institutions can nominate their clients online at www.pcmm.com.br between September 10 and October 10, 2012. Loan officers will play a fundamental role in the process through their visits to businesses and close work with clients.
tag-1: Brazil: Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards Highlight Top Entrepreneurs Funded by Microfinance
tag-3: São Paulo – Citi's Microentrepreneurship Award celebrates its eighth edition this year. Funded by the Citi Foundation in 28 countries, the award honors entrepreneurs who employ microfinance resources to boost their businesses, either through startups or by improving products and services, and contribute to economic and social development within their communities. Microfinance institutions can nominate their clients online at www.pcmm.com.br between September 10 and October 10, 2012. Loan officers will play a fundamental role in the process through their visits to businesses and close work with clients.
tag-4: Awards will be presented in three categories based on businesses' annual invoicing: up to R$60,000, between R$60,000 and R$180,000, and from R$180,000 to R$360,000. Three microentrepreneurs – one in each category – will receive R$8,500 each, and one grand prize of R$12,500 will be awarded to the top entrepreneur across all categories. Winners will be selected based on criteria that include prospects for sustainability, planning and conflict management, growth, job creation in the community and challenges the microentrepreneurs have overcome.
tag-5: For the first time this year, five loan officers will be awarded laptop computers – the four who nominate the winning businesses and the one that submits the most eligible nominations. Another novelty is an award to honor the most innovative microfinance institution. This award will take into account innovative lending practices. To participate, microfinance institutions must present evidence of how their innovations have benefited both their own and end-clients' operations, had a social impact and contributed to the expansion of microfinance and local development. The winner will receive an all-expenses-paid trip for two to the Inter-American Development Bank's 2013 Inter-American Microenterprise Forum.
tag-6: "Small entrepreneurs deliver innovative solutions that contribute to the country's economy, and microfinance makes the implementation of their ideas possible. This award allows us to recognize leading initiatives to encourage more entrepreneurs to follow the same path," explained Priscilla Cortezze, Director of Corporate Affairs and Sustainability at Citi Brazil.
tag-7: The inspiring stories of previous years' winners will be available at www.pcmm.com.br beginning September 10. Their experiences are examples of how microfinance has supported business growth, generated revenue and increased employment in local communities.
tag-8: "After I opened my first store with a micro loan, I began to see revenue come in, and I had faith it would work. Today I have seven stores," recounts 2011 winner Claudione de Assis Oliveira, owner of Karisma Network in Bahia.
tag-9: Citi's Microentrepreneurship Award 2012 is a partnership with the Avina Foundation and is supported by ABCRED (Brazilian Association of Microcredit and Microfinance Operators), ABSCM (Brazilian Association of Microentrepreneur and Small Business Credit Societies), BNDES (Brazil's Social and Economic Development Bank), MIF (the IADB's Multilateral Investment Fund), IFC (the World Bank's International Finance Corporation), SEBRAE (Brazilian Support Service for Micro and Small Enterprises), GVcemf (the Getúlio Vargas Foundation School of Business's Microfinance Study Center) and Giral (Giral Viveiro de Projetos, a São Paulo-based management consulting firm).
tag-10: For more information, please visit: http://www.pcmm.com.br/premiocitimelhoresmicroempreendimentos/ starting September 10.
